DataElement.preferredName: Prior First Clinical Study Pharmacologic Substance Administration Active Coronary Disease Less Than 6 Month Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient has active coronary disease within 6 months before the start of protocol therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior First Clinical Study Pharmacologic Substance Administration Active Coronary Disease Less Than 6 Month
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research._Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity._An imbalance between myocardial functional requirements and the capacity of the coronary vessels to supply sufficient blood flow. It is a form of MYOCARDIAL ISCHEMIA (insufficient blood supply to the heart muscle) caused by a decreased capacity of the coronary vessels._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::6_One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prior First Clinical Study Pharmacologic Substance Administration
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.:Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Property.preferredName: Active Coronary Artery Disease Less Than Integer::6 Month
Property.preferredDefinition: Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity.:An imbalance between myocardial functional requirements and the capacity of the coronary vessels to supply sufficient blood flow. It is a form of MYOCARDIAL ISCHEMIA (insufficient blood supply to the heart muscle) caused by a decreased capacity of the coronary vessels.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::6:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

Concepts.definition: Exerting influence or producing an effect.

Narrowing of the coronary arteries due to fatty deposits inside the arterial walls. The diagnostic criteria may include documented history of any of the following: documented coronary artery stenosis greater than or equal to 50% (by cardiac catheterization or other modality of direct imaging of the coronary arteries); previous coronary artery bypass surgery (CABG); previous percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI); previous myocardial infarction. (ACC)
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a history w
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history within 6 months prior to treatment of myocardial infarction, severe/unstable angina pectoris, CABG, NYHA class III or IV CHF, stroke or TIA?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of myocardial infarction within 6 months, unstable angina or NYHA classification of III or IV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of acute coronary syndromes (including myocardial infarction and unstable angina), coronary angioplasty, or stenting within 6 months prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had unstable angina pectoris, clinically-significant cardiac arrhythmias, stroke (including TIA, or other ischemic event) or myocardial infarction within 6 months before the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: eligibility
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of myocardial infarction within 6 months, unstable angina, resting ECG with clinically-significant cardiac arrhythmias or NYHA classification of III or IV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history of myocardial infarction within six months, unstable angina, resting ECG with clinically significant abnormal findings, or NYHA (New York Heart Association) functional classification of III or IV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any clinically important abnormalities in rhythm, conduction or morphology of resting ECG (e.g., complete left bundle branch block, third degree heart block, second degree heart block)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of myocardial infarction within past 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had myocardial infarction or unstable angina less than 6 months before registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had ischemic myocardial or cerebrovascular event, placement of pacemaker, or pulmonary embolism within six months of receiving first dose of MLN0128 (TAK-228)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had ischemic myocardial or cerebrovascular event, class III or IV heart failure, placement of pacemaker, or pulmonary embolism within six months of receiving first dose of MLN0128 (TAK-228)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had unstable angina pectoris, clinically-significant cardiac arrhythmias, stroke (including TIA, or other ischemic event), myocardial infarction or cardiomyopathy within 6 months before the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had myocardial infarction within 6 months of study day 1, or has symptomatic congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class III and higher), unstable angina, or cardiac arrhythmia requiring medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of acute coronary syndromes (including myocardial infarction and unstable angina), coronary angioplasty, or stenting within 6 months prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of myocardial infarction within past 6 months prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had unstable angina pectoris, clinically-significant cardiac arrhythmias, stroke (including TIA, or other ischemic event), myocardial infarction or thromboembolic event requiring therapeutic anticoagulation (Note: subjects with a venous filter (e.g. vena cava filter) are not eligible for this study)  within 6 months before the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had myocardial infarction within 6 months or uncontrolled angina within 3 months of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any clinically important abnormalities in rhythm, conduction or morphology of resting ECG e.g. medically significant (symptomatic) bradycardia, complete left bundle branch block, third degree heart block and second-degree heart block?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to first dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of myocardial infarction less than 6 months before start of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of acute coronary syndromes (including unstable angina and myocardial infarction), coronary angioplasty, or stenting within the past 3 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any of the following within 6 months before the first dose of study treatment: unstable angina pectoris; clinically-significant cardiac arrhythmias; stroke; myocardial infarction; a venous filter (e.g. vena cava filter); thromboembolic event?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had myocardial infarction or unstable angina less than 6 months prior to the first dose of ZEN003694?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had CVA, myocardial infarction, or unstable angina within 6 months prior to the first dose of ZEN003694 (ZEN-3694) or talazoparib?
